lines:
1956

15 February, 1917.

Mr. S. S. Kwan 
96 St. James Ave.

Boston, Mass.

My dear Kwan:

Your letter with its kind invitation has just been 
received. If you will tell me when you are planning to have 
one of your smokers in the near future I shall be glad to see

if I can arrange my work here so as to be present.

Needless

to say, I should value highly an opportunity to speak in a

wholly informal way to such a gathering as the one you have in

mind. I have been wway almost constantly for the last three 
weeks, however, chiefly for the purpose of visiting our alumni

associations in the middle West; and hence just now I am more

than ser crowded with work and somewhat reluctant to abandon

school duties even for a few hours.

I have no doubt, however,

that I could arrange to run in some evening in the near future 
that might prove mutually accept able to us.

No, I haven't heard from Tomy very lately. Since 
I turned over his funds to him he is not inspired to write qui te 
so' often as he used to. I hope, however, that he is getting on 
satisfactorily. As for yourself: I am delighted to hear that the 
work is going so well. I hope you will be able to clear up the 
condi tions in Applied Mechanics and get a clean slate before the 
year is over. The best of luck to you!

Always yours sincerely,
raw: 1956 15 February, 1917. Mr. S. S. Kwan 96 St. James Ave. Boston, Mass. My dear Kwan: Your letter with its kind invitation has just been received. If you will tell me when you are planning to have one of your smokers in the near future I shall be glad to see if I can arrange my work here so as to be present. Needless to say, I should value highly an opportunity to speak in a wholly informal way to such a gathering as the one you have in mind. I have been wway almost constantly for the last three weeks, however, chiefly for the purpose of visiting our alumni associations in the middle West; and hence just now I am more than ser crowded with work and somewhat reluctant to abandon school duties even for a few hours. I have no doubt, however, that I could arrange to run in some evening in the near future that might prove mutually accept able to us. No, I haven't heard from Tomy very lately. Since I turned over his funds to him he is not inspired to write qui te so' often as he used to. I hope, however, that he is getting on satisfactorily. As for yourself: I am delighted to hear that the work is going so well. I hope you will be able to clear up the condi tions in Applied Mechanics and get a clean slate before the year is over. The best of luck to you! Always yours sincerely,

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter reponding to the invitation to speak at the MIT Cosmopolitan Club and asking for possible dates, saying he is over crowded with work. He would consider speaking however. Stearns states he has not heard from Tommy and congratulates Kwan on his work, with hope that he will clear the slate with Applied Mechanics.
metadata.note_acquisition: Phillips Academy Archives and Special Collections received the letters and materials of Sung Sing Kwan from Alfred E. Stearns in ____(date)
metadata.note_preferred-citation: From The Trustees of Phillips Academy.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
